dt: {bc}to reduce especially by eliminating superfluous matter
{bc}to cut off or cut back parts of for better shape or more fruitful growth
{bc}to cut away what is unwanted or superfluous

et: Middle English {it}prouynen{/it}, probably ultimately from Old French {it}prooignier{/it}, alteration of {it}*porrooignier{/it}, from {it}por{/it}- completely (from Latin {it}pro{/it}-) + {it}rooignier{/it} to cut, prune, from Vulgar Latin {it}*rotundiare{/it} to cut around, from Latin {it}rotundus{/it} round {ma}{mat|pro-|}, {mat|rotund|}{/ma}
shortdef: to reduce especially by eliminating superfluous matter
to cut off or cut back parts of for better shape or more fruitful growth
